text: Glyptopetalum palawanense is a tree in the family Celastraceae. The specific epithet ' refers to the species being native to the island of Palawan in the Philippines. ==Description== Glyptopetalum palawanense grows as a small tree up to tall. Its twigs are coloured grey-green. The roundish fruits measure up to long. ==Distribution and habitat== Glyptopetalum palawanense grows naturally in Palawan and in neighbouring Sabah in Borneo. Its habitat is coastal ridges. ==References== palawanense Category:Trees of the Philippines Category:Flora of Palawan Category:Trees of Borneo Category:Flora of Sabah Category:Plants described in 1925 Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot Category:Taxa named by Elmer Drew Merrill
title: Glyptopetalum palawanense
